keyTakeAways: Lance Bass has type 1.5 diabetes, also known as LADA, and uses the Dexcom G7 Continuous Glucose Monitoring System to manage his condition.
Bass created an online persona called 'Blood Sugar Lance' to educate the public about diabetes with humor and entertainment.
He previously struggled with blood sugar monitoring, often leaving tests at home, but now uses continuous monitoring to better understand food triggers such as white rice and white bread.
Stress from his busy career and parenting his four-year-old twins impacts his blood sugar levels.
Bass denies any plans for an *NSYNC reunion, saying there is currently no news on the topic.
He criticizes media reports that speculate about a reunion without factual basis.
His family history includes a relative with type 1 diabetes, which influenced his early awareness of the condition.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Lance Bass, former member of *NSYNC, discusses his personal journey with type 1.5 diabetes (LADA), emphasizing how technological advancements like the Dexcom G7 system have transformed his daily management. He shares insights into food triggers, such as white rice and bread, and highlights the importance of support from the diabetic community. Despite fan speculation about an *NSYNC reunion, Bass firmly denies any plans, calling media reports misleading. He also introduces his online persona, 'Blood Sugar Lance,' as a humorous yet informative way to educate the public about diabetes, particularly through social media platforms like Instagram.
title: Lance Bass Has More to Say About Living with Diabetes Than He Does About an *NSYNC Reunion
